title: The 5-Complement Rule: When to Use the Upper Bead
description: The 5-complement is your first soroban technique beyond basics. Master this and calculations become much smoother.

content.intro: The 5-complement (also called "friends of 5") is the first intermediate technique in soroban. It handles situations where you can't add or subtract directly using just the lower beads.

sections.text: The 5-complement pairs numbers that add up to 5:
When you need to add but there aren't enough lower beads available, OR when you need to subtract but there aren't enough lower beads to remove.
When adding and no room in lower beads: ADD 5 (upper bead down), SUBTRACT the complement.

items: Add 4... only 1 lower bead left! Can't add 4.
Instead: Add 5 (upper bead down), subtract 1 (complement of 4)

sections.text: When subtracting and not enough lower beads: SUBTRACT 5 (upper bead up), ADD the complement.

items: Subtract 4... only 2 lower beads! Can't remove 4.
Instead: Subtract 5 (upper bead up), add 1 (complement of 4)

sections.text: Think of 5-complements as "trading" with the upper bead. Can't add? Get 5, give back the difference. Can't subtract? Give 5, take back the difference.

faq.question: How is this different from 10-complement?
faq.answer: 5-complement uses the upper bead within the SAME column. 10-complement carries to the NEXT column. You'll use both depending on the situation.

faq.question: Do kids memorize these?
faq.answer: Eventually, yes. But through practice, not flash cards. The patterns become automatic after enough repetition.

faq.question: What if I need both 5 and 10 complements in one problem?
faq.answer: This happens with complex problems. You apply whichever is needed at each step. Our app teaches this progression naturally.
